title: Bug 12428: Confusing message
description: Bug 12428: Confusing message. The current behavior of the software is causing confusion. When trying to pull up the method 'setUp()' from the 'TestCase' type, the message 'Copymethod 'void setUp()'' is displayed. The word 'Copy' should have an uppercase 'C'. Additionally, when selecting to delete the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase', the message displayed under 'TestCase' is 'Delete method 'void setUp()' declared intype 'junit.framework.TestCase''. This message should also use the fully qualified name.
OB: The software displays a misleading message when trying to pull up the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase'. The message says 'Copymethod 'void setUp()'', but the word 'Copy' should have an uppercase 'C'. When deleting the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase', a message is displayed under 'TestCase' that reads 'Delete method 'void setUp()' declared intype 'junit.framework.TestCase''.
EB: The message when trying to pull up the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase' should be consistent and use the fully qualified name. It should be 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'junit.framework.TestCase''. Similarly, when deleting the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase', the message should also use the fully qualified name and be displayed under 'junit.framework.TestCase'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue when trying to pull up the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase', follow these steps:
1. Open the software.
2. Navigate to the 'TestCase' type.
3. Select the 'setUp()' method in the 'TestCase' type.
4. Attempt to pull up the method.

To reproduce the issue when deleting the 'setUp()' method from 'TestCase', follow these steps:
1. Open the software.
2. Navigate to the 'TestCase' type.
3. Select the 'setUp()' method in the 'TestCase' type.
4. Choose the option to delete the method.
5. Observe the message displayed under 'junit.framework.TestCase'.
